subject: Relationships
title: Elderly Friendships: The Lifeline
description: A fast breakdown of Elderly Friendships: The Lifeline for builders.

hook.text: For elderly people, friends matter more than family for well-being. That finding surprises everyone.

buildup.text: A study of 280,000 people found that friendships predict health and happiness more than family ties in old age.

discovery.text: Friends are chosen bonds. That choice signals mutual respect and affection â€” qualities family can't guarantee.

twist.text: But elderly people lose friends to death, disability, and distance. Building new friendships becomes urgent and hard.

climax.text: The greatest gift you can give an aging person isn't money or medicine. It's consistent, reliable friendship.

punchline.text: In old age, friends matter more than family for happiness and health.

quiz.question: What matters more for elderly well-being: friends or family?
